sen.j: 林 忠交（はやし ただかた、弘化2年（1845年）- 慶応3年6月24日 (旧暦)（1867年7月25日））は、上総国請西藩の第2代藩主。
sen.e: Tadakata HAYASHI (1845 - July 25, 1867) was the second lord of Jozai Domain, Kazusa Province.
Tadakata HAYASHI (1845 - July 25, 1867) was the second lord of the Jozai Domain, Kazusa Province.
Tadakata HAYASHI (1845 - July 25, 1867) was the second lord of the Jozai Domain, Kazusa Province.

sen.j: 貝淵藩初代藩主林忠英の四男。
sen.e: The fourth son of Tadafusa HAYASHI, the first lord of Kaibuchi Domain.
The fourth son of Tadafusa HAYASHI, the first lord of the Kaibuchi Domain.
The fourth son of Tadafusa HAYASHI, the first lord of the Kaibuchi Domain.
His lawful wife was the daughter of Masanori KUGAI.
His lawful wife was the daughter of Masanori KUGAI.
His lawful wife was the daughter of Masanori KUGAI.
His childhood name was Takesaburo.
His childhood name was Takesaburo.
His childhood name was Takesaburo.
Jugoinoge Higo no kuni no kami (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade, Governor of Higo Province)
sen.cmt: 「肥後国守」は用語集ではなく他の「○○国守」の訳に倣い “Higo no kuni no kami” “(Governor of Higo Province)” としました。
sen.e: Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), the Governor of Higo Province.
sen.cmt: Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade)、およびthe Governor of Higo Provinceとし、ピリオド追加
sen.e: Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), the Governor of Higo Province.

sen.j: 1845年、林忠英の四男として生まれる。
sen.e: In 1845, born as the fourth son of Tadafusa HAYASHI.
In 1845, Tadakata was born as the fourth son of Tadafusa HAYASHI.
In 1845, Tadakata was born as the fourth son of Tadafusa HAYASHI.

sen.j: 兄林忠旭の養嗣子となる。
sen.e: Became the adopted heir of Tadaakira HAYASHI, his older brother.
He became the adopted heir of Tadaakira HAYASHI, his older brother.
He became the adopted heir of Tadaakira HAYASHI, his older brother.

sen.j: 嘉永7年（1854年）4月27日、兄の隠居にともなって家督を相続し、同年12月に叙任した。
sen.e: On May 23, 1854, he succeeded to the position of family head at the time of his older brother's retirement, and was then conferred to Jugoinoge on January or February of 1855.
On May 23, 1854, he succeeded to the position of family head at the time of his older brother's retirement, and was then conferred to Jugoinoge in January 1855.
sen.cmt: 全角アポストロフィーを半角に修正.、余分なスペース消去、on January or February of 1855→in January 1855に修正
sen.e: On May 23, 1854, he succeeded to the position of family head at the time of his older brother's retirement, and was then conferred to Jugoinoge in January 1855.

sen.j: 安政4年（1857年）閏5月に大番頭、安政6年（1859年）8月には伏見奉行となり、佐幕派として徳川家を支えた。
sen.e: He became Oban gashira (a captain of the great guards) in June or July of 1857 and then Fushimi bugyo (magistrate) in August or September of 1859 to support the Tokugawa family as one of the Sabaku-ha (supporters of the Shogun).

He became Oban gashira (a captain of the great guards) in June 1857 and then Fushimi bugyo (magistrate) in August 1859 to support the Tokugawa family as one of the Sabaku-ha (supporters of the Shogun).
sen.cmt: June or July of 1857→June 1858、August or September of 1859→August 1859に修正
sen.e: He became Oban gashira (a captain of the great guards) in June 1857 and then Fushimi bugyo (magistrate) in August 1859 to support the Tokugawa family as one of the Sabaku-ha (supporters of the Shogun).

sen.j: 慶応3年（1867年）6月24日、奉行在任中に伏見にて死去。
sen.e: Died on July 25, 1867 at Fushimi during the position of magistrate.
Died on July 25, 1867 at Fushimi during the position of magistrate.
Died on July 25, 1867 at Fushimi during the position of magistrate.
Died at the age of 23.
Died at the age of 23.
Died at the age of 23.

sen.j: 墓所：東京都港区 (東京都)愛宕 (東京都港区)の青松寺。
sen.e: Grave: the Seisho-ji Temple in Atago, Minato Ward, Tokyo.
sen.cmt: 「東京都港区 (東京都)愛宕 (東京都港区)」は重複を避けるため「東京都港区愛宕」として訳しました。
sen.e: Grave: the Seisho-ji Temple in Atago, Minato Ward, Tokyo.
